t: Jeremiah 50
Prophecies against Babylon
This*p is the word the Lord*s spoke about Babylon, the land of the Chaldeans, through the prophet Jeremiah:

Announce*pn to the nations; proclaim*ln and raise up a signal flag; proclaim,*ln and hide nothing. Say,*ln “Babylon is captured; Bel*ln is put to shame; Marduk*ln is terrified.” Her*ln idols are put to shame; her*ln false gods, devastated.
For*ln a nation from the north will attack her; it*ln will make her land desolate. No*ln one will be living in it — both*ln people and animals will escape.
In*ln those days and at that time — this*lg is the Lord’s*s declaration — the*pn Israelites and Judeans will come together, weeping*ln as they come, and*ln will seek the Lord*s their God.
They*ln will ask about Zion, turning*ln their faces to this road. They*ln will come and join themselves to the Lord*s in*ln a permanent covenant that will never be forgotten.
My*pn people were lost sheep; their*ln shepherds led them astray, guiding*ln them the wrong way in the mountains. They*ln wandered from mountain to hill; they*ln forgot their resting place.

Whoever*ln found them devoured them. Their*ln adversaries said, “We’re not guilty; instead,*ln they have sinned against the Lord,*s their*ln righteous grazing land, the*ln hope of their ancestors, the Lord.”*s
Escape*pn from Babylon; depart*ln from the Chaldeans’ land. Be*ln like the rams that lead the flock.

For*ln I will soon stir up and bring against Babylon an*ln assembly of great nations from the north country. They*ln will line up in battle formation against her; from*ln there she will be captured. Their*ln arrows will be like a skilled warrior who*ln does not return empty-handed.
The*ln Chaldeans will become plunder; all*ln Babylon’s plunderers will be fully satisfied. This*lg is the Lord’s*s declaration.
Because*pn you rejoice, because*ln you celebrate — you*ln who plundered my inheritance — because*ln you frolic like a young cow treading grain and*ln neigh like stallions,
your*ln mother will be utterly humiliated; she*ln who bore you will be put to shame. Look!*ln She will lag behind all the nations — an*ln arid wilderness, a desert.

Because*ln of the Lord’s*s wrath, she*ln will not be inhabited; she*ln will become a desolation, every bit of her. Everyone*ln who passes through Babylon will*ln be appalled and*ln scoff because of all her wounds.
Line*ln up in battle formation around Babylon, all*ln you archers! Shoot*ln at her! Do not spare an arrow, for*ln she has sinned against the Lord.*s

Raise*ln a war cry against her on every side! She*ln has thrown up her hands in surrender; her*ln defense towers have fallen; her*ln walls are demolished. Since*ln this is the Lord’s*s vengeance, take*ln your vengeance on her; as*ln she has done, do the same to her.
Cut*ln off the sower from Babylon as*ln well as him who wields the sickle at harvest time. Because*ln of the oppressor’s sword, each*ln will turn to his own people, each*ln will flee to his own land.
The Return of God’s People
Israel*pn is a stray lamb, chased by lions. The*ln first who devoured him was the king of Assyria; the*ln last who crushed his bones was*ln King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon.
Therefore,*p this is what the Lord*s of Armies, the God of Israel, says: I am about to punish the king of Babylon and his land just as I punished the king of Assyria.
I*pn will return Israel to his grazing land, and*ln he will feed on Carmel and Bashan; he*ln will be satisfied in*ln the hill country of Ephraim and of Gilead.

In*ln those days and at that time — this*lg is the Lord’s*s declaration — one*pn will search for Israel’s iniquity, but*ln there will be none, and*ln for Judah’s sins, but*ln they will not be found, for*ln I will forgive those I leave as a remnant.
The Invasion of Babylon
Attack*pn the land of Merathaim, and*ln those living in Pekod. Put*ln them to the sword; completely*ln destroy them — this*lg is the Lord’s*s declaration — do*pn everything I have commanded you.
The*ln sound of war is in the land— a*ln crushing blow!
How*ln the hammer of the whole earth is*ln cut down and smashed! What*ln a horror Babylon has become among*ln the nations!
Babylon,*ln I laid a trap for you, and you were caught, but*ln you did not even know it. You*ln were found and captured because*ln you pitted yourself against the Lord.*s
The*ln Lord*s opened his armory and*ln brought out his weapons of wrath, because*ln it is a task of the Lord God*s of Armies in*ln the land of the Chaldeans.
Come*ln against her from the most distant places. Open*ln her granaries; pile*ln her up like mounds of grain and*ln completely destroy her. Leave*ln her no survivors.
Put*ln all her young bulls to the sword; let*ln them go down to the slaughter. Woe*ln to them because their day has come, the*ln time of their punishment.
The Humiliation of Babylon
There*pn is a voice of fugitives and refugees from*ln the land of Babylon. The*ln voice announces in Zion the vengeance of the Lord*s our God, the*ln vengeance for his temple.

Summon*ln the archers to Babylon, all*ln who string the bow; camp*ln all around her; let none escape. Repay*ln her according to her deeds; just*ln as she has done, do the same to her, for*ln she has acted arrogantly against the Lord,*s against*ln the Holy One of Israel.
Therefore,*ln her young men will fall in*ln her public squares; all*ln the warriors will perish in that day. This*lg is the Lord’s*s declaration.
Look,*pn I am against you, you arrogant one — this*lg is the declaration of the*lg Lord God*s of Armies — for*pn your day has come, the*ln time when I will punish you.
The*ln arrogant will stumble and fall with*ln no one to pick him up. I*ln will set fire to his cities, and*ln it will consume everything around him.
The Desolation of Babylon
This*p is what the Lord*s of Armies says: Israelites*pn and Judeans alike have been oppressed. All*ln their captors hold them fast; they*ln refuse to release them.
Their*ln Redeemer is strong; the*ln Lord*s of Armies is his name. He*ln will fervently champion their cause so*ln that he might bring rest to the earth but*ln turmoil to those who live in Babylon.
A*ln sword is over the Chaldeans — this*lg is the Lord’s*s declaration — against*pn those who live in Babylon, against*ln her officials, and against her sages.
A*ln sword is against the diviners, and*ln they will act foolishly. A*ln sword is against her heroic warriors, and*ln they will be terrified.
A*ln sword is against his horses and chariots and*ln against all the foreigners among them, and*ln they will be like women. A*ln sword is against her treasuries, and*ln they will be plundered.
A*ln drought will come on her waters, and*ln they will be dried up. For*ln it is a land of carved images, and*ln they go mad because of terrifying things.
Therefore,*pn desert creatures will live with hyenas, and*ln ostriches will also live in her. It*ln will never again be inhabited or*ln lived in through all generations.

Just*ln as God demolished Sodom and Gomorrah and*ln their neighboring towns— this*lg is the Lord’s*s declaration — so*pn no one will live there; no*ln human being will stay in it even temporarily as*ln a temporary resident.
The Conquest of Babylon
Look!*pn A people comes from the north. A*ln great nation and many kings will be stirred up from*ln the remote regions of the earth.

They*ln grasp bow and javelin. They*ln are cruel and show no mercy. Their*ln voice roars like the sea, and*ln they ride on horses, lined*ln up like men in battle formation against*ln you, Daughter Babylon.
The*ln king of Babylon has heard about them; his*ln hands have become weak. Distress*ln has seized him — pain,*ln like a woman in labor.

“Look,*p it will be like a lion coming from the thickets of the Jordan to the watered grazing land. I will chase Babylon away from her land in a flash. I will appoint whoever is chosen for her. For who is like me? Who will issue me a summons? Who is the shepherd who can stand against me?”

Therefore,*p hear the plans that the Lord*s has drawn up against Babylon and the strategies he has devised against the land of the Chaldeans: Certainly the flock’s little lambs will be dragged away; certainly the grazing land will be made desolate because of them.
At the sound of Babylon’s conquest the earth will quake; a cry will be heard among the nations.
